title: Lugard voyage to the Niger MCQ 3

content.question: Which aspect of the historical situation in West Africa in the 1890s best explains the board of directors’ instructions to Lugard in article (h) of the letter?

choices.label: Europeans still had very limited information about the physical geography of the West African interior.
West Africa was becoming a source of important raw materials for Europe’s industrializing economies.
In the aftermath of the abolition of the trans-Atlantic slave trade, Europeans lost interest in West Africa, both politically and economically.
High levels of local resistance to imperialism effectively prevented Europeans from extending their control in West Africa beyond coastal regions until the very end of the twentieth century.

content.answer: West Africa was becoming a source of important raw materials for Europe’s industrializing economies.
